Instrument.name: The Rosetta Plasma Consortium (RPC) Ion and Electron Sensor (IES) for the Rosetta Orbiter
Instrument.description: The Ion and Electron Sensor (IES) element of the RPC measured the flux of ions and electrons as a function of energy and direction for the solar wind, for the environment of the various flyby targets, and the environment of the comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko. It was comprised of a double (one for electrons, one for ions) toroidal top-hat electrostatic analyzer. The common entrance aperture provided a 360 degree field of view in the plane of symmetry; electrostatic deflection provided a scanned FOV +/- 45 degrees normal to the axis of symmetry. The objective of the instrument was to obtain ion and electron distribution functions over the energy range 4.32 - 17.67 eV/e with a basic time resolution of 128 seconds.
